title: Calendar not syncing
content:
I'm setting up TB for the first time with multiple email and calendar accounts. Some are gmail / google, and others o365.

The primary TB account's calendar doesn't seem to be syncing fully. It's an o365. account. But the email is working.

I added an event on my Outlook for Android on my phone. Its appearing in OWA, and in New Outlook on my computer (so it did sync from mobile Android device to server, and from server to my New Outlook on the Windows desktop). But its not appearing in TB.

Not sure what to check or what the issue might be.

Also, I'd love to replace Outlook Android on my mobile with what I think is K-9. But can't get the same account referenced here to connect to the outbound server.

Welcome any help, and appreciate you all doing this collaborative work.
creator: eric.gombrich

title: Filters
content:
Hi. I have approximately 26 folders in gmail and 34 filters that sort messages from my inbox to the appropriate folder on the mail server. I am planning on rearranging the filters and would like to know if there is a preferred way to optimize them. For example, am I better off having individual filters (say from several health providers) that end up saving respective messages into a 'Health' folder OR should I have 1 filter that looks for each provider in turn (OR condition aka 'Match any of...' ) then moves them to the 'Health' folder.

Not worried about performance, but more wondering if one method is more efficient than another.

Also, I seem to recall seeing in the filter help pages that it is preferable to have local storage for filters as opposed to having the mail server sort them out. Why is that?


kind regards, Kirby
creator: kirbykroon

title: lokale mappen op gedeelde map bij Ubuntu 24.04 onder Virtualbox niet langer mogelijk
content:
Tot voor kort heb ik gewerkt met Ubuntu 20.04 onder Virtualbox 7.0.18 met daarin ge√Ønstalleerd Thunderbird 115.10.1, en dat gaf geen probleem. Sinds de overschakeling naar Ubuntu 24.04 is er wel een probleem, nl. het volgende:

Ik heb mijn e-mails opgeslagen op een gedeelde map binnen Virtualbox, maar Thunderbird zet deze map van de vorm "/mnt/Abc/XXX/.sec/Mail/abc123@gmx.com" om in "/run/user/1000/doc/3cb2559a/abc123@gmx.com". Dat gaat voor 1 keer goed, maar nadat Thunderbird opnieuw is opgestart, zijn mijn mails niet meer te vinden onder "/run/user/1000/doc/3cb2559a/abc123@gmx.com" en moet ik de lokale map opnieuw instellen. Dit is niet de bedoeling. Ik denk dat het aan die nieuwe Ubuntu-versie ligt, maar hoe kan ik dit oplossen?

I do not have a JUNK/SPAM file where things might be moving to, there is just no record of these missing emails.

title: Autentica tus registros SPF, DKIM y DMARC para elquijotedeoro.es
content:
Puede autenticar su dominio agregando l√≠neas adicionales a los registros DNS de su dominio. Esta tecnolog√≠a funciona como un sistema de permisos, que permite a nuestros servidores enviar correos electr√≥nicos en nombre de su dominio. Una vez hecho esto, todos los correos electr√≥nicos se firmar√°n con su nombre de dominio en lugar del nombre de nuestro servidor. Tenga en cuenta que algunos registros DNS pueden tardar entre 24 y 48 horas en actualizarse, as√≠ que espere algo de tiempo despu√©s de los √∫ltimos cambios. Haga clic aqu√≠ para obtener una gu√≠a m√°s detallada

DKIM: Tipo CNAME Nombre sender._domainkey Valor dkim.sendersrv.com Precauci√≥n: su dominio ya tiene un registro SPF: v=spf1 a mx include:sendgrid.net -all. Debe actualizar el registro existente insertando el siguiente valor: "include:sendersrv.com" as√≠: FPS:

TXT @ v=spf1 include:sendersrv.com a mx include:sendgrid.net -all

DMARC: TXT _dmarc v=DMARC1; p=none;
creator: loteriaselquijotedeoro

title: Downloading email messages
content:
Within last 2 to 3 weeks I noticed that when I click Get Messages the momentary line of text at bottom-left typically says "there are no new messages", or the "number of messages" about to be downloaded. (This is not the notification window at lower right.) Recently the number of messages actually received is not always correct. For instance, this morning the message was clearly "downloading messages 3 of 3", but only one appeared as a new, unread message in my inbox. This has occurred several times, sometimes qty is correct, sometimes not. My first question is whether this is a bug in Thunderbird, or something I need to pursue with my email provider? Second question: I am only requesting those for my account, but might the "missing messages" be downloaded for my wife's email?

If missing messages are for my wife how do I fix it so I only download mine? She doesn't have admin rights and I made no changes to our account settings. If missing messages are not hers then I am seriously concerned about this issue.
creator: RetiredMiner

title: Bug / issue with hyperlinks in emails
content:
I have come across an issue when replacing hyperlinks in emails.

The scenario is: I have an email that I have sent that includes a link (a zoom meeting).

I wish to send a similar email so I go to my sent items, find the previous sent email, and highlight, copy and paste the contents of the email that was sent to a new composed email.

I then copy the new link, highlight the existing link and paste the new link in its place.

I then confirm that I have the correct new link showing - I can see the meeting number within the link and it matches the new link.

However after sending the email, it is then converted to a hyperlink, and when hovering the mouse over the link, it shows the destination as the previous link that has been deleted.

This only appears to affect the html version of the email, so the plain text part is still correct.

Understandably, the problem isn't immediately noticeable as the link still looks correct, and it is only when clicking or hovering over the link that the discrepancy is evident.

I realise (now I am aware of the issue) this can be resolved by deleting the previous link first, then pasting the new link separately, but it would be helpful to know if there is a way to prevent this happening in the first place as it means having to remember that Thunderbird is quirky with swapping links.
creator: firefliesdreamer
